content: The app is a masterpiece. But I could not achieve good performance for mm6 (mandate of heaven). Produces only 2-4 fps on win95. I tried assemblies from the forum. I could not get the key differences. Huawei P30lite phone. processor: HiSilicon Kirin 710

This emulator is incredible. No doubt the developers put real effort in it. It supports bluetooth controllers, save states, mouse emulation, you can design your own keys layout, can set keys size, position even background. Save seperates layout for each and every game. Create shortcuts for games executables. And much more... Amazing !!!! It would be real great if there is an option to add photo on icons of game shortcuts we create
Purchased this app after finding that a lot of my old favorite MS-DOS CD-ROM based games run fairly well or at least acceptably well under the free version. It is also still actively updated.
Best DOS emulation on Android. Way more performant that any other application in store.

Edit: Never mind, I just dragged and dropped at the app data location and everything showed up. Love this app! Review: Hi, is there a way to import game data from other file than .mgc? I guess I didn't back up correctly so all I have are .xml files and 1 .bcp file. I previously set up 11 games, so I would like to not have to set them up again.
replyContent: Hi, you can sort them from main menu

content: Excellent. I love the infinite and fully customizable touchscreen control options. The very best.

This is the best DosBox version I've found on the Play Store. It supports external storage. I have Nesticle NES emulator for DOS running under it just fine. I've gotten DOS Sierra games to run with sound and even old Tandy color and sound games running under it. It will also let you create home screen shortcuts to your DOS apps. It is highly customizable, but a prior knowledge of DosBox on PC really helps when getting into the advanced features.
As advertised, I just wish the ui for path choosing was as comprehensive as the free version.

The strategies works well, but the mouse emulation for such a game like Tyrian 2000 is terrible. There is a game open Tyrian in the app store. It would be nice if the magicbox could use their methode to use your finger as a mouse. + the first person shooters like heretic, or hexen or doom or whatever isn't too good as well. The update of the emulated joystick is needed. And a gamepad emulation for games like postal would be nice. It could work for the fps games as well.
replyContent: Hi, for fps games try check our website forum, search for duke nukem 3d layout.It works really well, you can modify it for games like blood, skynet etc. Doom can be adopted with this layout too, but small modification of y axis, you can find this on forum, or post question and you get answer.Is necessary understand, games are emulated, not ported.

content: Has anyone been able to emulate a Tandy 1000 using Magic Dosbox?

This is amazing. I'm able to play some fantastic older games very smoothly on my phone. Currently enjoying steel panthers series. The customizable shortcuts are a what makes this a truly stunning application with limitless possibilities.
Excellent App have all the options needed to run any dos old games
Very good app
Solid
If uoy add: Start EXE files for dos app from anything file managers and procedure recall DosBox for this dos apps - be good. We can be write dos apps. But uses mouse and network....

replyContent: Unfortunately, we don't meet all requirements for google play on android tv. However, application is fully functional on this system.

content: Magic DosBox is an incredible piece of software. Talk about getting your money's worth. I've been able to play my favorite old computer RPGs from the ancient days of computing smoothly and with incredible customization of the UI at my fingertips. I've created perfectly tuned UI elements for each game that I've installed, and everything has worked as intended. Really, the best money I've ever spent on the Play Store. I'd give six stars if I could. Thank you for all your work.
Nice... Try to add full mouse and keyboard support to this app

First of all, thank you for this app. I really enjoy playing my old DOS games on Android and the range of customization is amazing. Also, the devs are very very responsive. Issue with saving preferences was fixed within 2 hours of sending them an email. Love this app!
replyContent: thank you

Great job this is so much easier!

content: What an awesome app works really well with Samsungs dex :-D I can carry and play my old game collection with me. The app is easy to use but let's you really dig into the emulator and set it up just right for each game.
Best thing I've downloaded in a long time. Thank you for the hard work.

content: Impressive. GUI is a little daunting, but far more manageable then dosbox turbo was. This is a definite improvement and is definitely worth a few bucks to replace the now defunct Dosbox turbo

The best.

replyContent: Hi, on our youtube channel is video guide how to run win 95. However, if like to refund then send me order number, I can't find your order without it.

content: Just fantastic. I am able to play a large variety of classic DOS games on my old Kindle Fire 7 (2015). Interface is easy to use. The customization options make playing most games a snap. I'm just enthralled. Best version of DosBox on Android hands down, and it allowed me to turn and old device into my gaming console of choice. I found a couple of the widgets that I couldn't get to work, and a few more system graphics to represent widget actions would be welcome. But, that's nitpicking. What works here, works perfectly. If I could give it 6 stars, I would.
replyContent: Many thanks. Widgets works in various different scenarios, you can freely ask what you need on our website forum or send me email, I can explain. I will try add more system icons, but just now I hardly work on some features. Maybe you can check our icons designer.

content: The Best MS DOS Emulator for Android. Love how I am able to setup a lot of control configurations using virtual buttons for a variety of games like fps, action, platform, action and adventure games
Beautiful app, good services, I hope I can give 6 stars .

easy to use, works better then dosbox turbo, fallout 1 native experience :) colud be possible implent support for fullscreen in samsung dex mode please? But i see this is problem with all emulators (epsxe, myboy!, etc) none of them work fullscreen in dex mode even with dex lab/game launcher.
replyContent: In next version will be dex mode for samsung devices fixed. It is fixed in beta version.

content: This is pretty amazing! Love it! It has tons of customization/tweaking options for stuff like how the mouse handles. You can even add custom virtual buttons to the screen, so you're able to e.g. switch between relative and absolute mouse modes on the fly - which works wonders in a game like C&c. I am very impressed with this app, couldn't recommend it stronger if you're into a bit of old school gaming on your tablet! Great work, devs!
Easy to use and awesome customisation. Great work guys!

Fantastic mobile DOS emulator, loaded with user-friendly features like shortcuts to launch games quickly and mapping keyboard and mouse inputs to controller buttons for a more comfortable experience. Mouse can also be mapped to the thumbstick or touch screen inputs. Works well sideloaded to FireTV, as well.
Reasonably easy to use, does its job with no problems.
Took a bit of configuration to get a joypad set up, but it's great. Good enough front end.

This app was put together and is supported by people who are passionate about DOS gaming. The support is fantastic, any issues I've had with game compatibility (which have been few and far in between) have been answered diligently. You can tell that the person who made this app cares about the integrity of his product. Highly Reccomended!
Works great for me and it is very easy to use.
The best android DOSbox i've tried so far, among many. Just needed to figure out how to grant it write access to my device's SD card, and it's perfect!!
Very good and easy to configure with good explanation for newbs like me :)

Amazing performance and an amazing developer super fast response. There is a beta version that works in samsung dex mode (at time of this review) and also if you are in dex mode and want full screen, just go to the display settings in game and disable navbar. Support this dev. Well worth it!
Amazing DOS emulator, works like a charm. Speedy support through emails as well üñ§üñ§üñ§üñ§üñ§

Only downfall is in sam dex you cant max the screen :(Best dos box I have used. With this and all the other good games coming out on Android I sold my computer. Thanks for a great program, had 0 problem playing quest for glory 1 2 3 4

I got Hocus Pocus (GOG), Commander Keen (steam), and Jazz Jackrabbit (GOG) up and running with no problem. Plays great! Working on getting the elder scrolls games and Ultima underworld running (all gog). Those a a bit of a struggle. But i think it's the files, not the app. Keep up the good work!
replyContent: Hi, many thanks. I can recommend our website forum and section for sharing mgc files. People shares there their layouts, maybe you can find there something useful for ultima :)

content: 64mb memory is too low to be able to run Fallout 2 with the Restoration Project. Dosbox Turbo doesn't have this limitation but doesn't run as smooth. Would be 5 stars otherwise.

Got it working. Good piece of software. The problem was that without the Roland patch (file disk09.lec), the game The Secret of Monkey Island doesn't work with any MT-32 software or hardware. That file is somewhat hard to find anywhere. Should have tested with Dune1 or any other game, less quirky. My bad...
replyContent: Thank you, what was the problem? Maybe I'll be ready to help someone else.

content: Though I am new to this command prompt stuff and currently experiencing difficulty installing games, this is perfect! I hope to learn more from this and I definitely support the app. From what I can see, customer support is awesome compared to Dosbox Turbo's. Keep it up!
replyContent: Many thanks

content: This app is awesome, it really adds new content to my chromebook while keeping space constraints in mind. I do have one request if possible. Can frameskip options be adjusted in easy config. By default its set to frame skip 2. My chromebook is strong enough to handle skip 0 for a smooth experience. On a side note how do I set up a controller for it, I didn't grow up with DOS so im very new and I like to use it for Mega Man X.
replyContent: Hi, frame skip can be adjusted inside game (in general settings window) or in expert settings config. For a controller guide I recommend video on our youtube channel.

content: Best DOS emulator
This does put a smile on my face.
The developer helped me with an issue and the app works perfectly now. Response time was within minutes of emailing. Great support and highly recommended.

content: I'm pleased overall, just wish there was xcopy support and glide.Other than that it does a good job.

Best dos app you will get, hands down. Flexible, easy to work with and plays everything.
As someone already pointed out, Master of Magic, enough said :) But seriously, much better than DosBox so far as controls and speed goes. Although I have not tried it for long.
works amazing for the three original duke games. got Duke 1 2 and 3d working. is amazing. I cant get dark forces 2 to run for whatever reason and would love to figure it out but whatever

content: Best DOS emulator on Android. Would it be possible to add Nuked OPL3 emulation for more accurate Adlib sound? Also more options to configure SB16 settings like OPL and mixer rates would be great.

content: It doesnt allow me to save the game im playing and the save state feature is finicky at best. The final straw was when the app reset itself, deleted all of the games I uploaded and deleted the save state files. I can't recommend this app to anyone
replyContent: Probably you placed your games on sdcard which by default allows only reading, no writing.That's why you see this disk red. Read application's manual instructions for grating write permissions.You should stop using applications like clean master because you do not know what all they delete.Or set application folder to private location, no to public

content: Works great and is easy to use.

What a great app. The customization is great and pretty straightforward. Its great to be able to setup your games list and have one tap to launch a game plus still have the functionality of dosbox. If you want to play dos games on your phone or tablet this is the way to do it.

Great emulator, possibly the best one on Android for Dos. Easy customizable controls and config for all games, and a nice little guide to start you off. Having trouble however with the widget layers, I used to have a portrait and landscape setup for Daggerfall, but now it only ever shows the portrait layer even if i hide it. besides that, it's basically perfect, ive already beaten TES: Arena using this, a game i would have never played otherwise. Thank you MagicDosbox Dev(s).

content: Absolutely superb. Makes other dosbox apps look ridiculous. Incredible performance, super friendly config, but most importantly, the interface design mode makes absolutely any old dos game playable on a phone. This app is worth every penny and more.

content: Way better than Dosbox Turbo and Manager. Could use a more material (or just cleaner) design, but it is very intuitive for the average techie. I like that this is more containerized. Criticism: Better design (in terms of theme and color choices) Being able to drop existing games into Collections (folders) Icon could be something nicer (personal preference) Some games require a joystick and a "fire" button, that I can't find a setting for mapping or emulating, such as Destruction Derby. I like it a lot and hope it keeps on improving. Better tutorials with improved production value would be nice. Add a "buy me a beer" donation link even in the paid version somewhere, so people can contribute more if they want.
replyContent: Hi Roberto, thank you very much for review and ideas. Just now is already possible add game profiles to folders. With fire button you have on mind special button for continual firing? I am just working on new icons for fantasy theme, I went over various colors and I am still not sure with final look, if you like, I can show it via email.

content: Best thing since sliced bread! I'll need to run a direct, quantifiable test against Dosbox Turbo, but magic feels faster and, in some cases, easier to setup. Full marks...
State of the art DOS emulation so for those wanting to run Windoze (sic) stuff buying this is a no-brainer. It will deserve a 5 star + rating when it switches to 64 bit architecture in 2019!

Nice and always updated, but more difficult to get help to set up than Dosbox Turbo. Most tutorials, like fallout 2 setup, are for Dosbox Turbo, and the official YouTube tutorials are not for GOG versions of games. Just a matter of time till Magic DosBox will be a replacement since it's still being updated. It just need easier tutorials and easier UI. Fow now, I recommend DosBox turbo for beginner/intermediate users. Only use this if you're familiar with dos emulators and scripting.

By far the best Android DosBox. The sophistication, degree of customisation, and transferability of the touchscreen interfaces you can design for DOS games is astonishing. Support is top notch too. Other DosBoxes can just about make a game "playable", this is the only one to make them genuinely enjoyable. I've just completed Ultima Underworld on my phone, and was able to design an interface that worked way better than the original game's did when I played it back in 1992!
Apologies for prior low review, just that app is very fiddly but once you figure it out after alot of work it's great
replyContent: Thank you very much, if you have any idea how to improve this emulator, I like to discuss them.

content: By far the best DOSBox you can have on Android. I will never understand how or why DOSBox Turbo is the one with more recommendations on the internet than this one. Magic It's way more intuitive to set up on both mobile and TV platforms, it supports all input methods including touch, mouse, keyboard and gamepads and it allows you to create custom layouts for each game that you can transfer between devices. It's also by far the fastest DOSBox Android build that I've tried. Oh, and did I mention the support for this app is great? Well, it is - the developer really seems to care. Highly recommended!
replyContent: Hi, I can help you if you send me email.

content: Excellent app and does exactly what it's supposed to do. You just need a basic understanding of how dos games work. (YouTube is your friend here)

Best overall dosbox port for android! The joystick mappers is excellent, and saving multiple configs is really simple. I like the layout, and the native keyboard is a really nice touch. Virtual joystick works fine as a gamepad, but not very well as an analog stick. Using a physical joystick to control the mouse has only one movement speed, which makes that feature practically useless, and I really wanted to use that feature! Dang. New update now allows you to hide the system mouse cursor, and that's so awesome!! The dev is very involved and always improving. Love this app!
replyContent: thank you

content:
This app is amazing! It makes messing around with dos so easy. I'm having a 
blast. I love the selection method for setting C: and auto running the old 
games with a simple tap is great. Making and perfecting control widgets is 
as fun as playing the games. Great work! My only suggestion would be for a 
widget that would trigger on release instead of on pressing. Seriously 
people, if you love an old dos game, buy this app. Thanks for the quick 
response. I did not notice that. Godspeed in your endeavors good sir. : )
replyContent: Thank you, widget's action is released based on widget's type. Combo/Deadly strike widget releases actions on finger UP.

content:
EDIT: The bug with design mode has been fixed, thank you for the fast 
response! I am raising this to 5 stars as a thank you. And I am using the 
Conservative UI, but the problem is with the actual content of the text, 
not the interface itself. I hope it will improve in the next updates. UI 
needs some work, sometimes the English text is so broken that I don't 
understand what a particular function even does. Another very annoying bug 
is when you set the back button to only show the menu when held down, if 
you then go to design mode it will not allow you to resume or do anything, 
with the only solution being to quit the app altogether. Can't complain 
about the performance, which seems really good.
replyContent: Thank you, please can you email me which texts are broken?

content:
Dev is an absolute genius! I didnt understand it at all at first and was 
going to ask for a refund. Dev turned it all around. He replied quickly and 
kept helping me step by step. he helped me get it up and running KQ7. App 
is running the game as perfectly as i remember back as little kid when it 
came out. Wish i could give more than 5 stars- thank you!

The physical mouse implementation is perfect!! Any chance you wanna help 
out the SCUMM VM team with that?
replyContent: Hi, mouse works differently in dosbox and in scumm. But...I was inspired by scumm, it has physical mouse implemented very well. Maybe only hiding cursor was not implemented. Android 7 supports custom image for cursor. In this case I used transparent image and cursor disappeared. Android 8 adds capture pointer - full support for mouse, API is easy.

content: It's a good app, fairly easy to use, and provides quality of life things like choosing the starting exe so you don't need to type it every time in the dos cl.  but can i transfer my saves from the free version? i used the free version to check if it is good and i beat the first boss in Dangerous Dave in the Hunted Manson.... i don't want to replay it :D
replyContent: Hi, you must export game to mgc profile, if I remember well, it export save states together with settings. Then import it in full version. Please contact me via email if it does not work. Or go to .MagicBox folder and rename GamesLite to Games, it should work too.

android

This is a fantastic DOS emulator. It has a steep learning curve, but the 
developer is willing to help and has a bunch of videos, a website, and a 
forum plus he responds to emails. I've wanted Dungeon Hack and other DOS 
games on my tablet for a while and now I can!

It's been two years now for me. Out the many DOSBox emulators that exist on 
the Play Store, this one stands out to be the greatest one. You Mr. Bruenor 
are still amazing!
Developer violate's DOSBox's GPL by refusing to release the source code. Has ignored attempts for me to contact them for months.
replyContent: I am sorry, we always provide source codes on demand. Please visit our website for details. We never received request from this account.

content:
Dosbox Turbo used to be my go to app for Dos, not anymore! Why? Because 
Magic Dosbox is easier to use, it's fast, and most importantly it has the 
most in depth customizable controls available. I can't tell you how 
important that is for the more complex PC games that use a large amount of 
keys on a keyboard. I was very impressed with the amount of customization 
and control I was given. Number 1 Dosbox app for 2018!

I used to play original Master of Orion a lot in the 90s on my PC. Later I 
used DosBox on Linux to play it. Now I can play MOO on my Samsung S8 Note. 
Works great. BTW, looking for keyboard? Press you back, on screen arrow in 
Android taskbar.
90s DOS games now playable on mobile platform, thanks to this app. I appreciate the wide array of control customization options as well.
Thanks Tony for your support over this weekend.

This is the first app I've ever purchased for my phone in years of using one. So far it's been pretty good.  I like the widgets. I DO WISH the bag had resizeable keys and more columns (13) so I could make a more complete keyboard.  It would just be easier to do that then mess with the available keyboard which blocks my view.  It would also BE NICE if there was a widget to swap layers.  I play Ultima V which requires some text typing so one might see how these things would be useful.  There's a few other things you could do with the widgets but I don't want to get into that here.  THANKS SO MUCH!
replyContent: Hi, keyboard is not editable, but you can redesign layer like a keyboard. Currently you can use layers for creating interactive menus. For example you can define "Spellbook" pages like a layers and switch them. You can hide/show picked layers with one of "Deadly strike/Combo" action.

content: Ok so this is awesome, and super easy to use compared with traditional dosbox.
replyContent: The "Mouse widget" has option for firing left+right button at once.

content: The app claims to support physical mice, and while it technically does, it reads the mouse pointer the same way it reads the touch screen, meaning that instead of moving the mouse pointer in the games, you move one mouse pointer that in turn moves the in-game mouse pointer. It does not act as it would on DOSBox on the PC and thus fails to solve the issues with the absolute mode for mouse emulation. The app also needs a way to adjust machine type in the normal settings without having to use the expert config editor (which tends to ignore some settings such as the aspect correction setting), since some games such as Lemmings require vgaonly. I would give this app five stars if it weren't for the mouse problem as everything else about this app is great.
replyContent: Hi, that mouse problem is caused by your Nvidia shield Tablet. You must go to shield settings and disable one option which is enabled by default (I dont understand why). It is something like "act pointer like a touch" or something like this.

content: The app crashes on startup now. It worked perfectly before but now I can't play at all. Please fix soon.  EDIT: It works now thanks to the devs. Amazing app.
replyContent: Hi, please can you contact me via email. The only thing what came on my mind is you have enabled console mode which is broken now due targeting Android 8. And this did small incompatibilities. We tried fix all, but we missed console mode. Old console mode will be fixed in next version and new console mode is in development.

content: Runs World Of Xeen flawlessly.
Awesome app, but create shortcut to home screen doesn't work on my pixel running 8.1 Oreo
replyContent: Hi, thank you for report. Will check it.

content: I'm glad I went with this and not the competitor. It's MUCH easier to use, games run great, and there's so much customization that I can configure my favorite games to control well on basically any Android form factor.
How are you able to align your virtual keys so perfectly and even?  Mine never look that good when trying to place them just by sight on the screen.
replyContent: :) This is easy. Go to edit mode and select widget. You should see now floating menu, go to second level and enable multi-selection. Now you can select multiple widgets and on second level will appear additional icons for aligning.

content: Great emulator! All of the input tools and widgets really make this app outshine other dosbox offerings. Make sure to try out the free version it will give you a good idea of how solid this app is. Documentation isn't the best though. I can't figure out how to add custom icons to widgets?
replyContent: Hi, thank you. To add custom icons : open widget properties and press orange "+" button.

content: Good app, you can easily convert any old dos game in an android game. But it need more configuration options like vertical and horizontal mouse sensitivity for games like doom, also it would be nice that when you power off the game you get to the game selection screen
replyContent: You can enable "return to main menu" in main menu options. I'll remove this option in one of next updates and people will return back always. Sensitivity can be set in mouse options, however is not split to horizontal and vertical.

content: The best.

The app is amazing!  Very easy to use (even for a NOOB like myself) and so customisable!  Whats best about the app is the team behind it.  Im not the best when it come to using DOS (thats an understatement) and managed to get a couple of my old games to work but got seriously stuck on one of them.  Emailed the team and within 10 mins i got reply back.  50 emails later.....we managed to fix the problem and get my game to work!  Big thank you to Tony @ Magic DosBox who went above and beyond to help me out!!  Cant wait to start playing my games on this!!  Highly recommend

I love everything about this app but I bought a new wireless bt controller and am unable to properly map the controls with BOTH analog control sticks with no luck.  Once I set controls for a game, just wanna be able to open the app and play each time. Is that possible? I tried the you tube vid that was made by dev but still no luck. Please help Broener!
replyContent: Sounds like you dont save settings. After setup go to General Settings again and press "Save" button on left bottom side of shown window.

content: Joystick support (real/emulated), Midi support (mt32/soundfont), video filters, customizable widgets, performance, quality, stability, wifi play, and profile backups!... if this was the last word on features for this app I'd still be 100% satisfied... but theres probably more on the way! The final feature I  think anyone could want on this would be gui supported voodoo emulation... something even I dont yet need. This version of dosbox is the best on the market, the easiest to use, and worth the price 100%.  Review Update Nov 20 2k17-- Oh wow. Save States. I figured Dosbox couldnt do savestates, and that I didn't need them for MS-DOS games... but Dosbox can and they are really convenient. This dev is a genious, and he is adding features I havent even thought about in DOS emulation. Other 5 star apps have nothing on this!
replyContent: Thank you very much. However I cannot take stars for save/load states, because patch was done by ZenJu, Tikalat, ykhwong and others. I only fixed some bugs caused by android system.

content: This app is amazing, and better yet, the people behind it are even better. I have only had a couple of problems, but whenever I said anything about them, they got back to me within 24 hours. Because of this, and because this is a great app, I've been able to play all of my dos games with ease and problem free.
replyContent: Thank you

content: Awesome! No other dos emulator competes with this! Thanks dev you are awesome!

This is the absolute best DOS emulator around. It has a bit of a learning curve, but truly didn't DOS itself and getting games to run have a bit of a learning curve. Once you understand the basics, you will be and playing all your DOS favorites in no time. I have yet to run across any game slow downs on a Samsung P-580. The s pen works as expected. The only weird problem I've encountered is that all the games I have setup will sporadically disappear and it is like I'm setting up Magic for the first time. I make a copy of my install folder to an external SD card so I always have a backup but this is just an inconvenience. Otherwise, this is completely top notch! And, easily the best purchase I've made ever on Google Play.
replyContent: Hi, we are working on workarounds for this disappearance. It started this year by applications like cleaners and by silent system updated. They clears internal storage of "trash". Next version will handle it better, for now please do backups to clouds.

content: Unbelievable... Best Dos emulator in existence.
Works flawlessly and fast. The widgets are great for creating a custom set of controls for each game. Totally worth the price!

This app is absolutely THE BEST! Definitely worth the price. Once I downloaded and installed it is the best interface. Easy to use. So many settings and configurations. I used to love DOS game called "Catacomb Abyss". I went to a website called dosgamesarchived. I downloaded it and with this app i opened it and it was like I was living in the 80's all over again. If you are old school dos and miss those games. This is your app. Most definitely worth the price. Highly recommend this app if you miss the old dos games. By the way, my USB game controller works awesome.

If you love old dos games, this is a MUST. two things to point though. Is it possible to exit a game and return to menu instead of home screen and second could you add an autosave for game settings? I keep forgetting after I set my keys.
replyContent: Hi, thank you.Return options can be set in menu (in option on right side to global settings). I'll think about auto save option in one of next versions. It was requested more times.

content: Awesome

Initially wrote a short review about difficulty during setup, and gave three stars, but the team got back to me quickly and provided information on a YouTube channel to assist with setup. I am impressed with the timely response and the videos will assist anyone with figuring out the app if you are having issues. Can't wait to play my copies of Betrayal at Krondor, Quest for Glory, and Fallout.
replyContent: Hi Daniel, thank you very much. I recommend youtube guides what have "installation guide" in title. But do not hesitate ask question on our website forum. This is better place then here, because answer here is limited to only 350 characters...

content: Best DOS emulator for Android, hands down. Try it and you will see why. It's easy to use and has amazing and highly customisable features. The premium version is also cheap. Dev is awesome, works with the community, and responds quickly. I wish all aps were of this quality.
Great app! Good for gaming heaven.

I am a true lover of old school gaming, and I'd always felt that other apps were clunky and cumbersome. Then in walks the app of my dreams! Magic Dos Box is the most amazing dos gaming emulator I've ever seen - I wish there was a pc version! Do /not/ hesitate to by this program. It is worth more than the minor fee they charge for it. To the Dev? You are incredible.

Fantastic dos emulator with lots of configuration options. Dev also post install guides on youtube for your fave dosgames to help you get them up and running and is very responsive both here and on youtube. Happy to pay for such a good dev alone and the excellent emulators is just a bonus. Keep up the good work bruenor.
The best and most customizable dosbox for Android. Dev clearly loves his project.
So customizable! Even a space combat sim like Privateer works on my phone since I can add all sorts of touch control buttons that link to keyboard controls.
Best dos emulator, period.

This is a superb app and a contender for "Greatest Emulator of All Time." If you enjoy DOS games and take the time to learn how to create widgets, you'll know I'm not exaggerating.... not even a little!
Fantastic!   The best DOS emulator.

Definitely the best DOS emulator on the market. Handy, incredibly efficient and customizable widgets make gameplay smooth on moble, and allow for greater immersion. Perfect for Fallout, Doom, or whatever DOS games that particularly tickle your fancy.
Many new improvement's.Im running this on an octacore phone and it is absolutely amazing.The developer has my money for any future projects.
replyContent: Hello, thank you friends for supporting :) Hope next year will bring yet better updates;)

content: My go-to Android DoxBox app.  This is an excellent, regularly updated enhancement of DosBox Turbo.  Many features, highly configurable, yet it's much easier to setup games than with previous Android builds of DosBox.  The author's website has a forum where you can get very quick tech support if you have any issues.  Definitely worth the $3.50 (USD) for the paid version since you help support the developer and allow him to keep regularly updating this.  Also, the paid version allows you to download user created touch screen controls for a number of the more popular DOS games, available on the developer's site.
Just upgraded from the free one. Unbelievable app. Wish I could give more stars!!

Magic Dosbox has to be the easiest to use, feature rich, highly configurable Dosbox ever. Great tutorials too. My only qualms is Magic Dosbox doesn't have a simple enough way to install Windows 95 on your device (have to use an outside PC Program that won't boot particular iso's easily) and no 3Dfx/voodoo support if I ever get the Windows version working - Dosbox Turbo has both of these.  Magic Dosbox does everything else better though, so I bought the Pro version because of that, definitely recommend.
replyContent: Thank you. Will try make it better.

content: New Material Design UI is a delightful improvement.

It's a great emulator, but you should make it so you can disable vertical mouse movement. I want to play Doom with relative mouse movement, but the Walking back and forth gets a little annoying. Other than that, this is the best dos emulator for Android by far.
replyContent: Hi, thank you and thank you for idea. I will work on relative mouse in one of next updates. I received several other improvements idea. For doom, you can still control it with virtual joystick (2axis or keypad). Maybe it can be more comfortable.

content: Awesome

Terrific piece of software, probably the best dosbox wrapper you can find on an Android, and the on-screen widgets really make it comfortable to play even on a phone. It's still in active development, and is free software. Would purchase again.
Excellent emulator. Works flawlessly, great options and customization, very intuitive. I felt compelled to buy pro after loving the demo version.
At the moment sometimes everything will reset and I will have to redo everything is there something I can do
replyContent: Hi, do you use system cleaners? If yes add exception on MagicBox folder. I don't recommend use any kind of system cleaners - unless you know what you do. Probably it removed other things, you only don't know about it.

content: I finally got Moo 2 working on my tab 's so I am happy as  can be.  I was wondering if 32 bit programs will ever be tried because some old games are using 32 bit installers. Thanks for a great program.

The *BEST* Dosbox by far. Worth every cent. Simple to run your games, but very powerful if you need to customize input. I've even managed to setup a full overlay for DoomRL, so anything can be done. I'll do TIE Fighter, Elite 2 and EotBeholder 2 next. Anywhere available that we can share our overlays with others? That'd make this *the* go-to purchase for any mobile device.
replyContent: Hi, thank you. Please check our website.

content: Well laid out and incredibly user friendly.
Amazing. Love it.
The daddy!
Runs awesome but lacks user-friendliness!
Looking for the best dosbox? Well look no further!! This one comes with all the bangs and whistles it needs and some more!
Dos emu with best controls.

The best Dosbox app, hands down. Fully customizable with an easy-to-use UI, as well as game organizer/launcher screen. Anything I can think of that would be nice to have is already implemented. Now I get to relive my childhood on the go! :D

TL;DR Amazing, speedy, and customizable DOSBox app for Android. Highly recommended over others!  I recently got a new, more powerful phone so I figured I'd try out DOSBox emulation again. I loaded up my previous go to app and was disappointed in the performance. Not only that but the custom virtual buttons wouldn't register more than one at a time. The performance bugged me the most as I used to run DOSBox on my old Windows XP laptop and it ran better than a quad core modern phone.  So, I went looking for a new app and saw someone mention Magic DosBox. Never heard of it but there was a free version to try out so I gave it a shot. A little confusing at first but the help tips got me through the interface options. And I was blown away at the customization options and the improved performance. THIS is what I expect a modern DOSBox app to be like! Being able to tweak settings and control layouts for every game is beautiful. The layout and controls for a platformer are very different to a pinball game.  Magic DosBox was an instant buy even from the limited free version options. Now I have total control over any DOS game I want to play. Keep up the great work bruenor!
App is great and dev is awesome - super helpful.  Highly recommended!

First off, id like to say I have downloaded plenty of apps from the google play store and I have NEVER left a comment before. That being said, I found this to be THE best emulator ive ever seen. The devs are constantly improving it and respond to problems people cant figure out. Just check out their YouTube tutorials on how to do just about anything this app does. Ive watched all their videos, I downloaded the free version to test it out and to be honest i was happy with just the free version!!
replyContent: Thank you very much. I really appreciate it. There is still a lot of features on  to-do list. Hope many of them will be reality in next year :) Happy new year and thank you one more time:)

content: I love playing all the old games I grew up with. It takes some setting up but anybody that has experience with DOS should be used to that.

I bought another one, but couldn't run my Windows 3.1 on it (that is, the other dosbox from another developer).  I set up my dosbox on PC, and simply copied to tablet - this ran it flawlessly. I added widget keys needed for touchscreen for each game. And the config is EASY to export to ALL my Android devices! So once it's set up, I can just export config and copy it to my next tablet/phone, and I don't have to re-do everything!  This dev has worked very hard (and it shows)!  Well worth the small fee!!
replyContent: Many thanks to you and to all people who helped and supported us. Happy new year! :)

content: Great
Best programme and support iv found. Well worth the cost
Perfect DOS. The only thing that would make it better is save states, which would have to be implemented in dos box.

I cannot thank you guys enough for this nice and proper app. Everything works fine and the setup is easy. I through played the might and magic trilogy already. And now I am playing both of the ultima 7 parts. Thanks to the widgets it is really great playable. Deadly strike to switch between walking and interaction modes (switching the mousekeys and hiding widgets, so it is really comfortable). But I hear always cracking sounds in the background, in Ultima 7 only so far. I tried to tweak the cycles of the CPU and also the sample rate, buffer size and buffers of the soundcard and all the different sound cards. But the constant crackling stays there. Do you have any advice for me here? Thank you again for this great app üòÄ. PS.: Thank you for your advice. I figured it out what the problem is. Iolo is wearing a firesword and the audio created by fire is just really ugly in Ultima 7. So Magic DosBox is working 100% correct. It is the game sound for fire which is quite irritating. Just wanted to let you know.
replyContent: Thank you, good to know, maybe it helps to someone else too

content: Cannot get castle of the winds to work at all. As this is the only game I really wanted to play this app fails for me
replyContent: Hi, I like to help you, please contact me on website forum or via email. Dosbox is MS-DOS emulator and Castle of the Winds is Win3.11 game. You need first start win3.11, then you can play it.

content: First of all, unlike other dosboxes, this one seems to be still actively developed and the devs listen to the gamers community. Second reason: supporting our Slovak brothers :) Greetings! Honza EDIT: i normally never comment/rate on apps but since this is the second best thing after sliced bread has been invented i am investing into a second comment :) if you want a functional, user friendly and simply the best DOS environment on your Android device - search no further as you have just found it. Period.
replyContent: Ahooj;) Dakujem :)

content: awesome retro
Omg the best

Wanted to run Ultima7 et al. The other dosbox ports crashed or just didn't work (at least I couldn't make them work after a couple of hours trying). This one worked almost right away. After minor tweaking had the mouse and sound working as well, and playability is sane. Also works with a physical bluetooth mouse. Nough said, bought the paid version :)

Does what it says and can set up games no problem. Runs mostly everything. But if it's possible get 3D acceleration put in for those later games in win95. Hope your thinking about it! Also I haven't been able to figure out how to get back to the main menu after exiting a game. When I push my phones "back" button it completely exits the program.
replyContent: Hello, to get back to main menu : enable "back to main menu" in "main menu" (near global settings). Plugin for 3dfx is really on to do list, but must be ported for mobile gpu's first. Software emulation is pointless, this is veeery slow.

content: This is a fantastic port of dosbox! It's so heavily customizable that you can fit it to suit any kind of game to play great, right on your phone. The help files are very good too. Overall it is a job very well done!
If you need help they will go above and beyond.
replyContent: Thank you:)

content: I'm not the most tech-savvy person, would be great if it had a way to simply download and open the games without any real technical knowledge. If it can be made more self-explanatory and simpler to operate I'd use this often and rate 5 stars. Obviously some people have figured it out, but I can't do it. Sorry mate.
replyContent: Hi, I like to help, please send me email or ask on our web forum. "Simple download and start" is impossible, because games are licensed with their makers. But on our website, youtube and facebook channel are many video guides to watch, but you need own copy of game. Many games really don't need deep technical knowledge for successful startup...

content: The best DOS emulator on Google Play, hands down. widget options add versatility for controlling the game. One suggestion though, could you add "find" function for journal widget? I think it will help us a lot for searching keywords in the walkthrough (if the walkthrough is wall of text that we often find in GameFAQ) Maybe the function exist but i dont know about that. Thank you very much!
replyContent: Hello, thank you very much. Hmm well, find option is good idea, I'll look at this.

content: Thanks, really good work. Virtual joystick works well in Wing commander. Previous version of app worked with x-wing but new version is not working well. After calibration the joystick moves constantly to the left turning the ship around. Any advice for that? EDIT: Fixed that with unticking "Timed"  in the joystick settings. But still when I move joystick it takes 2-3 seconds for the ship to actually respond, but looks like this is normal xwing behavior because on my pc it is similar.
replyContent: Hello, I tested that right now. 2-3 seconds for respond is unusual. I tried that right now with beta version and virtual joystick, it reacts immediately(will check later with official version). I use timed=false and I own GoG version. Do you use external or virtual joystick?Edit:tested with official version and works

content: Super easy to use. You set up the game's path ONCE! No more trying to remember the right file path every time. Definitely worth the money for the full version.  üòÉ

On an Android platform. Incredibly easy to use and powerful interface, allows all sorts of jiggery-pokery to be done with on screen controls. I love being able to programming my 8BITDO PRO and have a Bluetooth keyboard hooked up on my tablet. As a retro enthusiast I can't rate it high enough and a must buy for anybody that loves gaming. There are 100's of abandonware (free!) titles out there to download and play. I'm playing games I couldn't afford to buy back in the day. Well worth it.

Got ultima 5 running without much trouble.  Would be nice to have video and sound testing options and also a setting to have a keyboard come up right away both globally and per game/program. But very nice.  Also I'd love more widget images to choose from for custom buttons.   Permissions on SD is something I have to re-request very often which is unfortunate. S-pen could use improvements.  Best DOS experience on android by far.
replyContent: Hi, thanks for suggestions. I appreciate any new ideas. Please what you mean with "video and sound testing options". Btw, you can apply your own images to widgets. Open widget configuration and press orange button "+" under "Look and feel" section.EDIT : Hmm, SD permissions on your device don't survive restart or  app quit?

content: As the title says, now I have all my fave games from the old days in my pocket.  Got MoO2 working after reading other people's posts on the forum!
replyContent: cool:)

content: was a fan of dosbox turbo but this blows it out the water.
The best app I've ever bought! PLEASE keep up the fantastic work!
So far the best dos emulator! Great work,man!

I'm loving the ability to play the old games again and the YouTube Chanel with helpful tutorials is a nice touch. A problem I've found is it doesn't work right with my cleaner,if I clean this App it clears all my games and widgets so that I have to set everything up again . All in all I love this App.
replyContent: Hello, there, thank you very much. Cleaners are dangerous apps, I think they must be set carefully else they do problems. Try exclude MagicBox folder from cleaning process. But for every case, last version introduced backup system. Hope this helps. EDIT : Michael, please can you contact me?

content: Quick responses and updates that actually make the software better
Best dos emulator in the world thanks guys for the dos emulator                           („ÄÄ^œâ^)(„ÄÄ^œâ^)(„ÄÄ^œâ^)üëçüëçüëçüëçüëä
An amazingly superb DOS Emulator - the best there is. Wish I could give it 10  *s, rather than 5

Many thanks for this great app. It's fast, has a great interface and it's heavily customizable. Hands-down the best dosbox port on the store. I have one little issue though. I'm using a bluetooth keyboard, when it reconnects from standby mode the game resets itself, why?
replyContent: Hmm..I am not sure. MDbx may be restarted if you minimize it and start another memory intensive application.In this case android kills paused apps what eats more memory and reuses it for newly opened app.To prevent it mDosbox must save state onPause event and return it back onResume,but save/load states is not implemented.Is this what happens?

content: Hands down the best way to play old dos based games on android. The customisation is thorough and essential to set up controls the way you want to play. It has run every game i have thrown at it so far. I am impressed. Thanks dev!
Still awesome, but if it could have a save state option like those snes emulator will make this app awesomeness shoot through the roof.
replyContent: Hello, there was attempt to make save/load states, but unfortunately it didn't worked always correctly. Maybe in the future...

content: Easy to use with in depth customisation

I was able to install ms Windows 3.11, and several dos based games. Graphica, sound, and mouse support, with custom hotkeys. Only thing missing a a way to create complex macros (simple macros are possible) and key chords. I needed to press and hold alt+rShift+~ at the same time but was unable to emulate the key strokes.
So far all the DOS games I've tried are working great. Very intuitive, excellent range of customisation options for controls. If you want a DOS emulator on Android, look no further. Excellent work.

Setup is very intuitive and hard to screw up. When in-game, the button mapping takes time, but is full of options I almost wish I could apply this on other systems. The developer was very thorough with step by step instructions throughout the app so your never lost. Ironman super offroad was the only game I couldn't boot up since that required a win32 program.

Runs extremely well, I've copied 10 games and they all work.  The virtual controls and customization are critical and excellent. The developers website has lots of information on how to set things up and from the comments, he is active.  If you have a collection of old school games or want to, this is great to play on the go.   I recommend Betrayal at Krondor.
Best DosBox on the market, a lot of work has clearly gone into it and much better than DosBox Turbo. Support the developer and give it a go!

Great dev support. This really is the best dosbox port. Very stable. Constant updates. And the only one to support trigger buttons on the Nvidia Shield. Small suggestion, it would be cool to assign icons to games from JPEG files, instead of just seeing the C:\> prompt. Thanks again for helping people bring back great memories.
replyContent: Hello, thank you too. Please can you send me email about the JPEG suggestion?

content: Has all the features and also a great interface.
(see above)

This is the best x86 emulator currently available for Android -- and I've tried all of them.  It simply works, and the front-end interface makes it very easy to manage and launch DOS and Windows applications.  Speaking as a developer who has ported emulators to mobile devices, I'm very impressed by the emulator's performance as well as by its ease of use / accessibility for less experienced users.  It worked immediately and without any specialized configuration on my Nexus 6, while the more popular x86 emulators all had issues and required lots of effort to fine-tune.  I recommend this to anyone who wants to get up and running quickly with the best x86 emulation available on Android today.  Congratulations to the developer -- I hope this outstanding emulator finds the popularity it deserves!
replyContent: Hi, thank you very much for review. I appreciate it. Big thanks to everyone who ever helped with development.

content: praise to the dev/devs. This app is so amazing it will play any game i throw at it perfectly. Thank you for possibly the best app i have ever seen.

As great as this emulator seems, the internal on-board physical controls (not external) on my GPD XD device aren't detected, nor can they be used. I was hoping to configure the joypad buttons to the face buttons, but only the D-PAD is detected.
replyContent: Hello, first thank you very much for support. So, this means that the Voodoo mapper is not working? Please send me an email.

content: tl;dr; This is simply the best, fastest and intuitive DosBox for Android. I've tried most of the other ones: Aemula, aDosBox, AnDosBox and DosBox Turbo.  ******************************************************** Seriously, try the free if you don't believe me.  This is the best dosbox port to Android I have encountered. While the UI isn't always the most intuitive it's still massively better than the competition. Still it's fairly easy to set up your UI for the games and being able to make your own button layout and move them around in easy manner is simply great. Lot of attention to details in the user interface like color-coding of the buttons and having all the necessary things in one place and organized well unlike in the competitors is a huge plus as well. ******************************************************** It's also fast, responsive and has many things in it that show the creator's love towards the product. Hopefully it'll keep updated and that things like auto-resize for text boxes and other little improvements are done. Too bad about the limitations on external SD cards though, but that's not this app's fault.
replyContent: Hi, thank you very much for review. Really thanks. SDCard support on A5 and above is done. Testing started on Monday and will continue two weeks. If everything will go fine then this patch will be available in next version. I am happy for any idea what can improve mdosbox.Maybe it can't be done immediately,but I like to have every idea on the list.

content: best dosbox emulator ever , thank you for the good work .
Best dos emulator I have found
Tried the free version first. It worked great, so I paid for this one. Worth every penny.

Works better out of the box than other emulators combines the functionality of dos box turbo and manager. for games like fallout it's great.                   Still has issues with in game  sound      and more importantly I can't figure out how to mount my sd card as c: in the setup menu the box remains greyed out
replyContent: Hi, if your system allows the sdcard read-only access then GUI blocks mounting this disk as drive c:.Running games from read only disk will lead to many problems.But..in expert settings you can do it.GUI allows reading images, iso or similar files from read-only disk.You can configure paths in Global Settings. Please send me email if you need help.

content: It's worth buying because of how much you customize the interface for each game.  The features unique to Magic DOSBox are really worth it, particularly the Absolute Mouse manual correction (was needed to get the mouse in Might & Magic 4+5 to click exactly where I was tapping).  I have on-screen buttons for almost all my games.  It's really necessary to customize each game if you want to play with just the touchscreen.  I also don't get the sound cracking I was getting in DOSBox Turbo.
I can't  believe  I'm  playing Bard's tale 3, Crusaders of the dark savant and Eye of the beholder 2 on my note 3. Great app.

Only didn't give it five stars due to lack of a virtual joystick. Would love this feature to be added. Would also like to see the ability to be able to group games into folders and also to add shortcuts to the app drawer in the same way as it adds shortcuts to the home screen.
replyContent: Hi, virtual joystick is implemented.Place Master of Puppets widget on the screen (must go to layout editation).Grouping games is currently not implemented. You are first who requested this, but nice idea, thanks for hint. But you can make shortcuts on desktop and let launcher to group them. What is app drawer?:)Btw on website you can find more info

content: Absolutely awesome app. I am currently enjoying designing key,mouse widget layouts for my favourite old dos games on my Lenovo tablet.... Brilliant!
replyContent: Hi, thank you :) You can find some layouts on forum too, people are sharing there their layouts.

content: This is my absolute favorite android app! I have been playing Wasteland and Elder Scrolls: Arena every day on this. It runs smooth as butter, and you have the ability to create your own custom controls for every game you play. I had a few problems when I first downloaded this, but I emailed the developer and my questions were answered right away. I am so glad I was able to find this app. If you want to play old DOS games on your phone with the best emulator you can find for Android, download this app now!

I love this app! If you love old DOS games, then definitely get this. I've got Ultima VII - The Black Gate, Wizardy VII - Crusaders of the Dark Savant, Might and Magic IV - Clouds of Xeen, Ultima Underworld, Eye of the Beholder, Witchhaven, and Conan the Cimmerian all running in this app. I donated so I could play more than one game. The ability to add keyboard and mouse widgets to your screen is awesome, and specific to each game! So don't sit here reading this -- get it!
Its way better then dosbox turbo none of that sound crackling good work
Awesome, everything works just as it should, no problems at all. Got few dosbox emus, but this one is best ;-) and its from my homeland :-P
Good GUI, very easy setup and fast emulation.

I love the widgets and ease of use.  You can see this developer worked hard to make this a great experience!  I think it's only going to get better as it's updated to allow easier creation of widgets, but it's still  5 star application.
replyContent: Hi Ian thank you. Version 18 will introduce much better widget management in design mode(If version 17 will not require bug fixes).

content: I've been playing Wasteland and Warcraft II perfectly. This is the best DOS emulator on the playstore. I used the free version and immediately paid the 5$ for the full version because it works so well. Much thanks devs!
replyContent: I want to thank all for supporting the project. It is good to know that people can appreciate hard work. Thank you...

content: I've been very impressed so far. Previously, I've used WinUAE, which has worked, but normally the interface ends up clunky at best. With MagicBox, for almost every game I've tried so far, that interface is beautifully smooth. It perfectly emulates 'Bards Tale', 'Menzoberranzan' and 'Strahd's Possession' (the three I've tried at length so far).   In fact, it does better than just repeat the functionality of the original: you can create your own on-screen keyboard, combining multiple actions at a touch. So, in 'Bards Tale', rather than laboriously hitting c for a spell, selecting the character, typing out the spell code, hit return, select where I want to cast it etc, I can do all that with one click. Amazing.  The only problems I've run into up until now are dodgy mouse emulation when trying to play 'Battlemaster' (perhaps due to the age of that game) and some issues with the CD on Daggerfall. MagicBox seems happy enough to install from CD and it will load if I then immediately go into the game from there, but attempting to run the new install off the main MagicBox screen brings up 'can't find CD' errors (though that's could be an issue with the game rather than MagicBox).

By far the best DOSBOX port on Android. Unlike others this concentrates on playability on a touch screen. It is possible to define multiple on-screen "widgets" which enable to play the DOS games as comfortably as possible. It requires a bit of initial effort, but it is far better than recommending various separate keyboards (as do the authors of other ports). Also developer responded very quickly when I encountered a small problem.
Great for war craft, this app is a must have for old school gamers! - jay

I've been using Dosbox Turbo for almost 2 years now, but it's finally been topped. So far, every game I've tried on this runs at least as fast as DBTurbo, with most of the games running even faster. The mouse movement is superior. It's very smooth and precise. I have yet to experience even slight pointer lag. But it's shining feature is the the custom widgets. They offer so many control options. You can use them to set up buttons with assigned keys or macros anywhere on screen, all of which can have your own text labels (or even custom images as icons) and can be resized and moved individually. So far I haven't run into a limit to how many I could add, which is very useful if you play the old school RPGs that use a ton of keyboard keys (I set up 26 around the edges of the screen for Ultima 5). There are several additional widgets that add other really nice control options as well. Highly recommended for any classic gamer.  I also wanted to add that the developer was quick to respond and very helpful when I emailed him about an issue I ran into (which simply turned out to be a wrong setting on my part).
Wonderful program
Honestly the best DOS port for Android. Running Master of Orion 2, Master of Magic, and Warcraft 2 on default settings without a flaw. Beats DosboxTurbo hands down.
This is THE dos emulator, I can mount cd images, I play my old school windows/DOS games, this app is truly amazing, 5 stars but it deserves 6...
